items.guidanceText:
The criterion will address the assessments made at the screening visit, to evaluate whether the subject is considered not to have any co-morbidities that prohibit inclusion in the trial. Consider if certain organ systems need to be assessed and if ‘abnormal, not clinically significant’ is acceptable in certain circumstances/for certain organ systems, or this needs to be more stringent. 

If lipids are to be assessed at screening, this is covered by laboratory tests in this criterion, but are to be clearly specified in the flow chart
items.name: Considered eligible based on the medical history, physical examination, and the results of vital signs, electrocardiogram and clinical laboratory tests performed during the screening visit, as judged by the investigator
items.namePlain: Considered eligible based on the medical history, physical examination, and the results of vital signs, electrocardiogram and clinical laboratory tests performed during the screening visit, as judged by the investigator

attributes.definition: The criteria in a protocol that prospective subjects must meet to be eligible for participation in a study. NOTE: Exclusion and inclusion criteria define the study population. See also exclusion criteria. (CDISC glossary)
